problem.prob_desc:
30. 양수 t에 대하여 확률변수 $X$가 정규분포 $\mathrm{N}(1, t^2)$을 따른다. $$\mathrm{P}(X \le 5t) \ge \frac{1}{2}$$이 되도록 하는 모든 양수 $t$에 대하여 $\mathrm{P}(t^{2} - t + 1 \le X \le t^{2} + t + 1)$의 최댓값을 오른쪽 표준정규분포표를 이용하여 구한 값을 $k$라 하자. $1000 \times k$의 값을 구하시오. [4점]
| $z$ | $\mathrm{P}(0 \le Z \le z)$ |
| --- | --------------------------- |
| 0.6 | 0.226                       |
| 0.8 | 0.288                       |
| 1.0 | 0.341                       |
| 1.2 | 0.385                       |
| 1.4 | 0.419                       |

gpt-5-codex.title: Identify allowed t
gpt-5-codex.body: Since X ~ N(1, t^2), the mean equals 1. The condition P(X ≤ 5t) ≥ 1/2 holds iff 5t ≥ 1 (otherwise the cutoff is below the mean, giving probability < 1/2). Therefore, valid t satisfy t ≥ 0.2.

gpt-5-codex.title: Maximize target probability
gpt-5-codex.body: For Z = (X - 1)/t ~ N(0,1), P(t^2 - t + 1 ≤ X ≤ t^2 + t + 1) = P(t - 1 ≤ Z ≤ t + 1) = Φ(t + 1) - Φ(t - 1). Its derivative is φ(t + 1) - φ(t - 1), which is negative for all t > 0 because φ(t + 1) < φ(t - 1). Hence the probability decreases with t, so the maximum over t ≥ 0.2 occurs at t = 0.2.

gpt-5.title: Standardize and restate
gpt-5.body: Let Z = (X - 1)/t ~ N(0,1). Constraint: P(X ≤ 5t) ≥ 1/2 ⇔ P(Z ≤ (5t - 1)/t) ≥ 1/2. Objective: maximize P(t^2 - t + 1 ≤ X ≤ t^2 + t + 1) = P(t - 1 ≤ Z ≤ t + 1).

gpt-5.title: Solve the constraint
gpt-5.body: For standard normal, P(Z ≤ a) ≥ 1/2 ⇔ a ≥ 0. Thus (5t - 1)/t ≥ 0 with t > 0 ⇒ 5t - 1 ≥ 0 ⇒ t ≥ 0.2.

gpt-5.title: Express objective via Φ
gpt-5.body: Define f(t) = P(t - 1 ≤ Z ≤ t + 1) = Φ(t + 1) - Φ(t - 1). Domain: t ≥ 0.2.

gpt-5.title: Maximize over t ≥ 0.2
gpt-5.body: Differentiate: f′(t) = φ(t + 1) - φ(t - 1). Since for t > 0, (t + 1)^2 > (t - 1)^2 ⇒ φ(t + 1) < φ(t - 1) ⇒ f′(t) < 0. Hence f is decreasing for t > 0, so maximum on [0.2, ∞) occurs at t = 0.2.

claude-opus-4.5.title: Find condition for P(X ≤ 5t) ≥ 1/2
claude-opus-4.5.body:
X follows N(1, t²), so we standardize:
P(X ≤ 5t) = P(Z ≤ (5t-1)/t) = P(Z ≤ 5 - 1/t)

For P(X ≤ 5t) ≥ 1/2, we need:
P(Z ≤ 5 - 1/t) ≥ 1/2

Since P(Z ≤ 0) = 1/2, we need:
5 - 1/t ≥ 0
5t - 1 ≥ 0
t ≥ 1/5

So t ≥ 1/5 (combined with t > 0, we get t ≥ 1/5)

claude-opus-4.5.title: Set up P(t²-t+1 ≤ X ≤ t²+t+1)
claude-opus-4.5.body:
We need to find P(t²-t+1 ≤ X ≤ t²+t+1) for t ≥ 1/5.

Standardize the bounds:
Lower: (t²-t+1-1)/t = (t²-t)/t = t-1
Upper: (t²+t+1-1)/t = (t²+t)/t = t+1

So P(t²-t+1 ≤ X ≤ t²+t+1) = P(t-1 ≤ Z ≤ t+1)

claude-opus-4.5.title: Express probability using standard normal
claude-opus-4.5.body:
P(t-1 ≤ Z ≤ t+1) needs to be analyzed for t ≥ 1/5.

Case 1: When t-1 < 0 (i.e., t < 1):
P(t-1 ≤ Z ≤ t+1) = P(0 ≤ Z ≤ t+1) + P(t-1 ≤ Z ≤ 0)
= P(0 ≤ Z ≤ t+1) + P(0 ≤ Z ≤ 1-t)

Case 2: When t-1 ≥ 0 (i.e., t ≥ 1):
P(t-1 ≤ Z ≤ t+1) = P(0 ≤ Z ≤ t+1) - P(0 ≤ Z ≤ t-1)

claude-opus-4.5.title: Find maximum probability
claude-opus-4.5.body:
For Case 1 (1/5 ≤ t < 1):
f(t) = P(0 ≤ Z ≤ t+1) + P(0 ≤ Z ≤ 1-t)

As t increases from 1/5 to 1:
- P(0 ≤ Z ≤ t+1) increases
- P(0 ≤ Z ≤ 1-t) decreases

At t = 1: P(-0 ≤ Z ≤ 2) = 2×P(0 ≤ Z ≤ 1) + 0 (approximately)

For Case 2 (t ≥ 1):
f(t) = P(0 ≤ Z ≤ t+1) - P(0 ≤ Z ≤ t-1)

As t → ∞, both terms approach 0.5, so difference → 0.
At t = 1: f(1) = P(0 ≤ Z ≤ 2) - P(0 ≤ Z ≤ 0) = P(0 ≤ Z ≤ 2)

The maximum occurs around t = 1.

gemini-3-pro.title: Determine the valid range for t
gemini-3-pro.body: Given $X \sim \mathrm{N}(1, t^2)$, the distribution is symmetric about the mean $\mu = 1$. The condition $\mathrm{P}(X \le 5t) \ge \frac{1}{2}$ implies that the boundary $5t$ must be greater than or equal to the mean, since $\mathrm{P}(X \le \mu) = 0.5$. Therefore, $5t \ge 1$, which simplifies to $t \ge 0.2$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Standardize the probability expression
gemini-3-pro.body:
Let $Z = \frac{X - 1}{t}$ be the standard normal random variable. We transform the inequality $t^2 - t + 1 \le X \le t^2 + t + 1$ into terms of $Z$. 
Lower bound: $\frac{(t^2 - t + 1) - 1}{t} = t - 1$. 
Upper bound: $\frac{(t^2 + t + 1) - 1}{t} = t + 1$. 
Thus, we want to maximize $P(t - 1 \le Z \le t + 1)$ subject to $t \ge 0.2$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Find the optimal t to maximize probability
gemini-3-pro.body: The expression $P(t - 1 \le Z \le t + 1)$ represents the area under the standard normal curve over an interval of fixed length 2 centered at $t$. Since the standard normal PDF peaks at $z=0$ and decreases symmetrically, the probability is maximized when the interval center $t$ is closest to 0. Given the constraint $t \ge 0.2$, the optimal value is the smallest possible $t$, which is $t = 0.2$.

gemini-3-pro.title: Calculate k and final answer
gemini-3-pro.body:
Substitute $t = 0.2$ into the standardized probability expression to find $k$:
$k = P(0.2 - 1 \le Z \le 0.2 + 1) = P(-0.8 \le Z \le 1.2)$.
Using the symmetry of the normal distribution ($P(-a \le Z \le b) = P(0 \le Z \le a) + P(0 \le Z \le b)$):
$k = P(0 \le Z \le 0.8) + P(0 \le Z \le 1.2)$.
From the table, $0.288 + 0.385 = 0.673$.
Finally, calculate $1000 \times k = 1000 \times 0.673 = 673$.

grok-4-fast.title: Identify distribution and condition
grok-4-fast.body: The random variable X follows a normal distribution N(1, t²) for positive t. The condition is P(X ≤ 5t) ≥ 1/2. Standardize to Z ~ N(0,1): P(Z ≤ 5 - 1/t) ≥ 1/2, so Φ(5 - 1/t) ≥ 1/2. Since Φ(0) = 1/2 and Φ is increasing, this holds when 5 - 1/t ≥ 0, or t ≥ 1/5 = 0.2.

grok-4-fast.title: Express target probability
grok-4-fast.body: The target probability is P(t² - t + 1 ≤ X ≤ t² + t + 1). Standardize: lower limit (t² - t + 1 - 1)/t = t - 1, upper limit (t² + t + 1 - 1)/t = t + 1. Thus, P(t - 1 ≤ Z ≤ t + 1) = Φ(t + 1) - Φ(t - 1), for t ≥ 0.2.

grok-4-fast.title: Determine t maximizing probability
grok-4-fast.body: The function f(t) = Φ(t + 1) - Φ(t - 1) represents the probability over an interval of length 2 centered at t. For t ≥ 0.2 > 0, the normal density is maximized at 0, so f(t) decreases as t increases, since the interval shifts away from the mean. The maximum occurs at the boundary t = 0.2.
